data.title: Exploring the World: A Comprehensive List of Countries in 2024
data.meta_description: Discover the total number of countries globally in 2023, including a detailed continent-wise breakdown and insights into the world's newest nations.
data.text:
List of countries in the world: Have you ever wonder that How many countries are there in the world? so, here’s the answer, there are 195 countries in the world. In total of 195 countries, 193 countries are the members of United Nations and the remaining 2 countries are part of non-member observer states. Below is the 195 country name list along with continent-wise countries names in the world. South Sudan is the newest country in the World, it is declared independence from Sudan on 9th July 2011.

List of Total Countries in the World

There are 195 countries in the world. Among them 193 countries are part of United Nations (UN) and they are Member States of UN and 2 countries are Non-Member Observer States – The Holy See and Palestine. There are 48 countries in Asia, 44 countries in Europe, 54 countries in Africa, 33 countries in Latin America, 14 in Oceania and 2 countries in North America are there. The Full list of countries in the world are updated over time due to various factors, including international relations, border disputes, and political developments.

Also Check: Most Powerful country in the world

Number of Countries Not in the List

There are some countries in the world which are not an official country as per United Nations People often consider it as a country in the world but they are not a country itself. Following countries are excluded from the total of 195 countries in the world:

Taiwan– The UN has considered it represented by the People’s Republic of China.

The Cook Islands and Niue, both states in free association with New Zealand, are neither member states nor non-member observer states, although they are both recognized as having “full treaty-making capacity” and are members of a number of UN specialized organizations.

Dependencies (also known as dependent territories, dependent regions, and dependent dependencies) and regions of Special Sovereignty (also known as autonomous territories) are other countries that the UN has recognized as not having their own sovereign authority.

Also Check: Largest Continent in the World

Facts About Different Countries in the World

Here are some interesting Facts about different countries in the world:

1. Finland, the Happiest Country

This Nordic nation consistently tops the charts in happiness surveys, thanks to its emphasis on social welfare, education, and work-life balance. They even have an official “Ministry of Happiness”.

2. Iceland, the Renewable Energy Pioneer

This island nation runs entirely on renewable energy sources like geothermal and hydropower, setting a global example for sustainable development.

3. Japan, the Land of Ancient Traditions

Home to the oldest continuously operating company in the world (Kongo Gumi, founded in 578 AD), Japan seamlessly blends modern technology with centuries-old customs and rituals.

4. Bolivia, the Sky-High Lake

Nestled in the Andes Mountains, Bolivia boasts Lake Titicaca, the highest navigable lake on Earth, sitting at a breathtaking 3,810 meters above sea level.

5. Mongolia, the Vast and Sparse

With only 1.9 people per square kilometer, Mongolia holds the title of the least densely populated country. This vast landscape offers stunning natural beauty and a glimpse into nomadic traditions.

6. Switzerland, the Tunnel King

This mountainous country boasts the most tunnels per capita globally, with over 170 tunnels for every 100,000 people. Talk about efficient transportation!

7. Vanuatu, the Shortest Anthem

This Pacific island nation holds the record for the world’s shortest national anthem, clocking in at a mere 11 words: “We stand united in God, Vanuatu!”

8. Tuvalu, the Low-Lying Gem

This island nation is the world’s lowest-lying, with its highest point only 4.5 meters above sea level. Climate change poses a significant threat to Tuvalu, raising awareness about environmental issues.

9. Bhutan, the Happiness Index

Unlike other countries that focus on GDP, Bhutan prioritizes happiness. They have a unique “Gross National Happiness” index, measuring the well-being of its citizens.

10. Canada, the Coastline King

This North American nation holds the title for the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 243,000 kilometers. From rugged Atlantic shores to Pacific fjords, Canada’s coastline offers endless beauty and adventure.

How many countries are there in 2024?- FAQs

Are there 256 Countries in the World?

No, there are not 256 countries in the world. There are 195 countries in the world, according to the United Nations. This includes 193 member states and 2 non-member observer states.

What is the Top 10 Richest country in the World?

Generally, countries like Luxembourg, Switzerland, Norway, Qatar, Singapore, Ireland, Iceland, Denmark, United States, and the Netherlands often appear on such lists based on GDP per capita or other economic indicators.

What is the Smallest Country?

The smallest country in the world by area is currently Vatican City, with a mere 0.49 square kilometers.

What is the World’s Largest Country?

The world’s largest country by area is Russia, spanning over 17 million square kilometers.

How many Countries are in Asia?

There are 48 countries in Asia according to the United Nations’ definition.
